CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 7, 1945, pg. 18, reads: "FAMILY REUNION - Happy that her sons were home again, Mrs. Annie E. Jones of 311 Robert Street gave a family dinner in their honor, recently. The three brothers are: Pfc. Edward A. Jones and T/5 William Jones, who were with the first American troops in New Guinea, and Pvt. John Jones of Camp Kilmer, N. J.  Pictured in family party are, left to right: Edward, John, Mrs. Jones, the mother; William, Mrs. Juanita Page, Carolyn Page, Emmett Jones, Anna Marie Jackson, Mrs. Evelyn Jackson and Jake Jackson.  Front row: Pauline Bowe, Mattie Bowe, Mary Louise Jones and Kay Sandra Jones. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Jones family, including Edward Jones and John Jones wearing military uniforms, Annie Jones, William Jones in uniform, Juanita Page, Carolyn Page, Emmett Jones, Anna Marie Jackson, Evelyn Jackson, Jake Jackson Pauline Bowe, Mattie Bowe, Mary Louise Jones, and Kay Sandra Jones, gathered around dining table with chickens and casserole dish, in Jones home, 311 Robert Street
